disclaimer.title: Beta version
disclaimer.paragraph_1: Only use with small amounts of bitcoin or use testnet.
disclaimer.paragraph_2: This software is in beta. It's thoughtfully tested and secure, but expect hiccups here and there. You can also change the Bitcoin network to
disclaimer.paragraph_4: as we make improvements and find bugs.
disclaimer.paragraph_5: Our application is free and open source so you can also

settings.headline: Settings
settings.title: Settings
settings.subtitle: Application
settings.testnet_title: Only for testing and development using test bitcoin (tBTC) instead of actual bitcoin (BTC). Compatible with all hardware devices
settings.auto_refresh_title: By turning off the auto-refresh, you will need click on the refresh top button to resync your config data
settings.notification_incognito_title: Notifications are still enabled but no information is shown

config_file.title: Manage your config file
config_file.paragraph_1: Keep your config file in a secure place, with your seed recovery backups for instance. Your config file doesn't hold any private keys but is enough to view all your account balances and transaction history. Make sure you have downloaded the latest version below. Dux doesn't have any copy of this information. You are in charge, which means that you are responsible to keep it safe.
config_file.paragraph_2: Below, you can download your config files with two options
config_file.paragraph_3: which is an encrypted copy of your config file. It's better for privacy but you will have to use the Dux desktop app to read it.
config_file.paragraph_4: which is your plain text config file. It's better for interoperability with other bitcoin software but you can leak all your balances and transaction history.
config_file.paragraph_5: You can also change your password, if you have created one.

coldcard_setup_file.title: Coldcard multisig setup file of
coldcard_setup_file.paragraph: Import that file into the Coldcard via a Micro SD card so that it can sign transactions along with the other hardware devices from the same vault. On the Coldcard, go to 'Settings > Multisig Wallets > Import from SD'. You'll have a chance to view the details of the wallet before accepting it.

change_password.title: Change password
change_password.subtitle: Your new config file will be exported
change_password.different_password: Use a different password for the new one

add_password.title: Add a password
add_password.subtitle: All account(s), wallet(s), vault(s) will be secured and your config file exported

switch_network.title: Switching to
switch_network.paragraph_1: You are about to switch to Testnet, the test network of Bitcoin. Only for testing and development using test bitcoin (tBTC) instead of actual bitcoin (BTC). Compatible with all hardware devices.
switch_network.paragraph_2: You are about to switch to the Bitcoin network (also called mainnet). Do you want to continue? Use with small amounts of bitcoin. Our software is still in beta.

cannot_switch_network.title: Cannot switch to Testnet
cannot_switch_network.paragraph_1: Your current config file doesn't allow you to switch to Testnet. Some of your hardware devices may not be compatible (i.e. Coldcard).
cannot_switch_network.paragraph_2: Change your hardware device network settings to Testnet and try again.

home.intro_body_line_1: Add a wallet or create a multisig vault to manage your bitcoin.
home.intro_body_line_2: All keys are held by your
home.intro_body_line_2_cta_title: Currently compatible with Coldcard, Ledger & Trezor. More to come!
home.config: Already have a vault or a wallet?

lockscreen.paragraph_unsecure: You can now access your dashboard right away.

reset_overlay.title: Reset your Dux Reserve app?
reset_overlay.subtitle: All saved accounts, wallets and vaults will be deleted from the app.
reset_overlay.paragraph: Dux Reserve cannot help you recover this information as we do not have it. No need to worry. It doesn't affect your bitcoin private keys as long as you have your hardware devices kept safe with their seed recovery backups. You will be able to create a new password on the Dux desktop app, and add your same devices to see your wallets and vaults once again.

micro_sd_coldcard_export.title_1: 1/2. Add vault setup file to your Coldcard
micro_sd_coldcard_export.title_2: 2/2. Add vault setup file to your Coldcard
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_1: Using that file, your Coldcard can sign transactions along with other hardware devices from the same multisig vault. If you don’t do it, your Coldcard won’t work within your vault.
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_2_1: Insert a Micro SD card into your computer (max 32 GB)
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_2_2: Click the 'Export Coldcard multisig setup' button and save the file into the Micro SD
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_2_3: You can now unplug your Micro SD card
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_3: Using that file, your Coldcard can sign transactions along with other hardware devices from the same multisig vault. If you don’t do it, your Coldcard won’t work within your vault.
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_1: Power up your Coldcard and unlock it
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_3: Settings > Multisig Wallets > Import from SD
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_4: Before you accept, you can review the details of your vault before
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_5: Confirm your vault setup. Your Coldcard is now ready to sign
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_6: You must do the same with all Coldcard hardware devices used in this multisig vault
micro_sd_coldcard_export.paragraph_4_7: You can now delete the exported vault setup file from your computer

config_file.subtitle: Your config file explains where to find your bitcoin
config_file.paragraph_done: It's important to store your config file in a secure place with your key backups, for instance. It doesn't hold any private keys, but is enough to give access to all account balances and transactions history
config_file.paragraph_new_added_1: It's important to store your config file in a secure place with your key backups, for instance. It doesn't hold any private keys, but is enough to give access to all account balances and transactions history. Your config file was updated with your new vault. Make sure that you download and securely store your updated config file, which includes details from your previous setup with the new wallet or vault that you have just created
config_file.paragraph_new_added_2: No account will be created with Dux Reserve for now, which means that you are 100% responsible for taking care of your config file. We do not keep any copy of it. For now, you will have to upload this file anytime you want to access your wallet(s) or vault(s)
config_file.paragraph_new_1: It's important to store your config file in a secure place with your key backups, for instance. It doesn't hold any private keys, but is enough to give access to all account balances and transactions history
config_file.paragraph_new_2_2: details. No account will be created with Dux Reserve for now, which means that you are 100% responsible for taking care of your config file. We do not keep any copy of it

choice.headline: Pick what works for you
choice.subtitle: Either way, hold your own keys
choice.wallet_tooltips: Great way to get started with Dux! Use a watch-only wallet connected to your hardware device to manage your bitcoin.
choice.wallet_body: Use your single hardware device for easy and secure key storage with to spend from your wallet.
choice.vault_tooltips: Gradually dip your toes into bitcoin multisig. Instead of a single point of failure hardware device, add multiple hardware devices to protect your bitcoin for the long term. Also works in testnet to try it without any stress.
choice.vault_body: Use multiple hardware devices to easily secure your holdings, manage your keys and spend from your vault.

user_password.subtitle_new_password: Secure the access to your dashboard
user_password.subtitle_confirm_password: Required to add a new account
user_password.paragraph_new_password: If you lose it, you will have to reset the Dux app and add your accounts all over again. It does not affect your private keys or your bitcoin holdings.
user_password.paragraph_confirm_password: If you lose it, you will have to reset the Dux app and add your accounts all over again. It does not affect private keys or your bitcoin holdings.

quorum_choice.headline: Pick your multisig vault
quorum_choice.subtitle: Use as many keys as you want
quorum_choice.2of3_paragraph: Simple set of 3 hardware devices where only 2 are required to spend your bitcoin. For medium-sized holdings.
quorum_choice.3of5_paragraph: Set of 5 hardware devices where only 3 are required to spend your bitcoin. For large holdings or team sharing.
quorum_choice.custom_paragraph: Create vaults with M of N hardware devices up to a maximum of 15. Only for advanced users.

key_choice.subtitle: It's time connect your
key_choice.key_1_paragraph: Pick your first hardware device to add its public key to your vault
key_choice.key_2_paragraph: Pick your second hardware device to add its public key to your vault
key_choice.key_3_paragraph: Pick your third hardware device to add its public key to your vault

fee_error.purge_rbf_tooltips: Replace-by-fee (RBF) is a method that allows to replace an unconfirmed transaction with a the same transaction but with a higher transaction fee

coldcard_micro_sd.title: Sign your transaction via Micro SD
coldcard_micro_sd.subtitle: Export your previously imported your setup file into your Coldcard. If you haven’t done it already, you can do it from your vault settings

coldcard_micro_sd.paragraph_5: Review the transaction details and sign

broadcast.blockstream_body: To keep things simple, we are currently using Blockstream's full node to send your transaction to the Bitcoin network. You will be able to add your node later on for better privacy in the future.
